dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mentioned San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate what you done for me back there but I ain't takin you all the way to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --My business is in Nevada. Can you get me that far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for someone. You hungry or not? Piper considers for a moment, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I could eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Milton. You're Piper, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try to kill me and dump me in the desert I'll cut your nuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pool tables, old pin ball machines and an odd mix of BIKE COWBOYS and the SLUTS who love them. Piper and Milton slide into a booth. Piper eyes a Latino BUSBOY, nice biceps, jeans too tight. ROY, a greasy fella in his fifties approaches, big happy looking fucker, owns the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings folks, welcome to the Bull by the Balls... He stops. Smile fades. Stares at Milton, mouth agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton? Roy doesn't even try to hide his dislike of Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hoped I was dead. Not the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You planning on staying? Milton eyes a door marked âMotel Guestsâ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your money's good as any Iâspect. But be gone by dawn. With Roy turns his back on them and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in another life I used to drive a truck through these parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'd spend the night here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd spend the night here fucking his wife. Suddenly Milton twists around, stares toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...nothing I guess. A large breasted waitress, fuckin' hot for a woman in her fifties, approaches with chips and salsa. Eyes Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello. I'm Candy. Start you off with some drinks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same. Candy plops two pens and index cards on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll need to see your IDs. Piper pulls her license absently and slides it over, begi filling out the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it's been awhile since you drove that truck through here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a drink? You gotta be a member. Dry county.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Utah, Mr...
She takes his license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This license isn't just expired. It's an antique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, then bring me a milk. She tosses his card on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, gorgeous, we'll break the rules. Shhhh, don't tell nobody. Milton watches her go. Drinking her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tap that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tap what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Milton, how long's it been? Sounds like you used to stick it in anything with a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well. I've been distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. But nobody reaches the end and says, âWish I hadn't fucked so much.â Milton's gaze returns to Candy. Even a man as driven as h needs a reboot sometimes. Candy catches his look, smiles. Piper slides from the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do my nails, take a hot bath and sleep in a warm bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drink it. See you at dawn. But she walks right passed the âMotel Guestsâ door an approaches the Busboy, who's already eyeing her. As she does, our focus settles on a shadowy area at the b of the bar. JONAH KING steps into the light. Ruggedly goo looking. He wears a necklace with something bulky hidden beneath his shirt. There's an old scar under his left eye but a scar on this guy simply adds to his fuckabilty fact He glances at Milton then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Roy isn't it? Roy spins from the bar, smiles a friendly smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is. Get you a drink friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic place you have here. You don't happen to rent it out for parties do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure do. You planing a party? Again Jonah glances at Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. Tonight, in fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Television chatters away with local nightly news. Fra ignores it, paces on the phone. As he does, we see Jonah King's face on the TV. The same guy from the bar. Archive footage of him preaching, warm, friendly.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK TV NEWS
dialogues.text: Mom...Mom...Mom! Would you Reverend Jonah King, the self- shut up and listen?! I've proclaimed prophet whose lost her for good this time. church has come under fire She's gone. I just want my for his anti-establishment car back. (a beat) messages, is wanted for Because...because...arrrg! questioning in the brutal Because I smacked her one, murder of the young parents. okay?!. Smacked her a couple While police say this is a of times, in fact. (a beat) routine questioning witnesses You don't think I know that?! place King in the area and Mom...Mom! It's over! End of have recently learned that story. She ain't coming King had a prior relationship back. Mom...mom...Mom! with one of the deceased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Frank clicks his phone shut, jerks the door open to find The Accountant smiling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an old man, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha? The Accountant sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White hair. Angry with attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sumbitch kicked me in the face. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Accountant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wha? I called the cops, not a bean-counter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man? Where did he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck should I know where he went? I woke up and all three were gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bitch, the old man and my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, fuck you. You ain't no cop. I'm done talking. Frank starts to close the door but the Accountant grabs h wrist, twists him around and shoves him into the room! Frank doesn't stumble forward. He flies. Lifted off the ground his toes drag the floor, Frank SLAMS into the oppo wall and bounces into the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a -- Frank staggers to his feet. Dazed. Mouth bleeding. He wipes blood onto the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...you made me bleed. Frank pulls a baseball bat from behind the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave me no choice but to beat you with this Louisville Slugger. Frank takes a step, swings at the Accountant. The Accountant dodges. Bat SMASHES down on the TV. SPARKS & GLASS fly. The Accountant STOMPS on the bat, SNAPS it in two. SLOMO: The short end rips from Frank's hands, knocks him backwards. The piece spins in the air - for a second, han there until... The Accountant snatches it, letting his follow-through ga momentum. Frank can only watch as the Accountant -

The tip STRIKES Frank in the shoulder with such force, it impales him up to the knob. Drives him backwards where it embeds into the wall! The Accountant grabs the broken barrel end of the bat, to it from hand to hand with a loud SLAP of flesh on wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed) I...what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your car. What kind is it? Frank stares down at the bat protruding from his shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha...what did you do? The Accountant reaches out and twists the bat. Frank SCRE out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A â67 GTO! Arrgg! The Accountant turns and walks toward the door. Stops to a framed photo of Piper and Frank on the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Just hold on! The Accountant pivots and flings the barrel of the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming right at his face. Frank tries to dodge...twi his head...no good. The other end of the broken bat RAMS through his face, PI his head to the wall. The words Louisville Slugger just visible where Frank's face should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Accountant exits as two STATE TROOPERS approach, thei vehicle parked behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Raimi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called about a stolen car? The Accountant gestures over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In there. Trooper #1 moves toward the opened door. The Accountant steps in front of Trooper #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for someone. Five- eleven. White hair. Driving a â67 GTO. He's traveling with her. He hands Trooper #2 the framed photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? The Accountant pulls a shiny, ancient coin, worn from bei worried over the years, from his pocket. He tosses it, th coin catching the light, glinting madly. Trooper #2 stare it. Can't seem to take his eyes off it. Trooper #1's eyes widen as he stares into Frank's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. He pulls his gun. Points it at the Accountant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your hands where I can see them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troopers, this is your lucky day. Trooper #2 is watching the hypnotic glinting coin. ANGLE - High looking down on the trio as the coin spins r in front of us - we glimpse the ancient face in the worn silver - Roman maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us your hands, asshole. (to his partner) What's the matter with you?! Draw your weapon!
Trooper #2 slowly reaches for his gun until... The Accountant snatches the coin from the sky, thrusts it the two cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Look at this. They don't see a coin. But a badge. Letters F.B.I. on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... you're a Fed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In pursuit of a white haired man. John Milton. He's travelling with the girl in this picture. Trooper #1 fixes his eyes on the photo of Piper & Fra his partner's hand. Lowers his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, that guy, in the room. He's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Dead. Yes. I'd say it's unfortunate, but I'd be lying. World won't miss him. Look, troopers. I need your help with my pursuit of this fugitive. If we, we three, can apprehend him...you are ambitious, correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't actually a question. I can tell you are. Success will mean promotion. Pay raise. I guarantee it. Now we are going to hunt this Milton, we are going to find the GTO he's driving and when we find him, you will shoot to kill. You understand? Shoot. To. Kill. The Accountant's voice is velvet. Hypnotic. Seductive. Purposeful. Promising glory with a hint of damnation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's against protocol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man is highly dangerous. He has killed and will kill again. He must be taken down on sight. The time it takes you to follow your protocols is the time it takes him to end your life. The Accountant crosses to the cruiser's back door, the co disappearing back into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're staring into two motel rooms. We're cheating...the wall that divides the rooms...divides the screen. The bed in each room butted up against the dividing wall. On one side we see Piper, on her back. Still clothed. At her feet, on his knees and completely naked, the Busboy. He's painting her toenails. On the other side we see Milton, on his back. Candy ridin him like a fucking big-tittied stallion. Candy is a SCREA The Busboy looks up, timidly. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, are we gonna do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know, baby. Depends on how well you do those nails. Now pay attention. You might need to redo that one. He hunches over and gets back to work. As Piper ties her hair up with a pink bandanna. Candy's SEX SCREAMS are starting to annoy the fuck out of her. She twists around with frustration and POUNDS the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up in there! Milton twist and POUNDS the wall right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut the fuck up! That's it! Piper swings her legs off of the bed. Busboy wasn't prepa and topples backwards to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggles) Oh! Sorry, I didn't mean... She stops. Stares. Movement. Someone stepped quickly away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper BURSTS into the room ready to kick ass and take nam But...the place is...empty. Food still on the plates. Bee in the mugs. The TV over the bar is still on. We see footage of a Nevada Amber Alert. âBaby Tabitha s missingâ A photo of a baby in pink onesie. Then appeari beside it...the photo of Jonah King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...issued an all points bulletin for Jonah King's immediate detention in connection with the murder of a young married couple in Loveland, Colorado. Their infant girl is believed to have been abducted by this religious sect. A nation-wide Amber Alert is now in full effect. Piper stares at the TV for a moment, then scans the bar. What the fuck? She eyes the EXIT sign where an assortment of athletic equipment hangs from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper exits with a hockey stick. A few cars are left in the lot. A black Chevy van with fl stands out, parked in front of a barn/storage building. Piper crosses to a window in the bar/motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busboy sits on Piper's bed. Still naked. He holds her nai polish to his nose. Sniffs. Jerks his head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imbecile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper spins, grips the hockey stick. No one. The cars are empty. The barn looks undistur... A light GLOWS within the barn, bleeding through the wood slats. Then... CRREEEEEEEK...barn door slowly swings open. ...revealing THREE SILHOUETTES backlit by a hanging lamp. One holds a shovel. The other heaves an ax over his shoulder. The third holds a shotgun. The side door on the flamed van slides open. TWO SILHOUET step out. Baseball bat and machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper spins as THREE DARK FIGURES appear around the side the bar/motel. Sledge hammer, iron pipe, sickle. Surrounded. All seven begin walking toward her. Piper rushes back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still empty. Piper turns toward the door marked âMotel Guestsâ then hesitates. Instead she dives under a booth table...as... The back door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEGS. Three sets. Beat up sneakers. Work boots. Cowboy boots with a duct tape patch. A door opens. Piper sucks in breath. More legs appear.
Shadows approach the desk counter near the âMotel Guest door. There's an open guest book on the counter top.

dialogues.speaker: GUEST BOOK
dialogues.text: As a weathered hand comes into view. A finger traces down the last two entries. Piper Lee RM 111 John Milton RM 112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy's still on top. She is, as we say in the fuck industry, âcloseâ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close'm'close'm'close'm'close. Suddenly Milton's head jerks toward the door. His hand shoots beneath his pillow as-- The door BURSTS OPEN! MAN WITH AN IRON PIPE held high rushes into the room. Milton comes up with a 357 hand cannon!

dialogues.speaker: KAFOOM
dialogues.text: IRON PIPE is BLOWN backwards into MAN WITH MACHETE! Milton thrusts upright, suddenly Candy finds herself bene him as -- Machete HEAVES Iron Pipe to the side and rushes toward Mi as -- KAFOOM! He's blown off his feet!

dialogues.speaker: KER-SMASH
dialogues.text: The window shatters as a MAN WITH BASEBALL BAT dives, hit rolls and comes up swinging! Milton snakes an arm beneath Candy and rolls from the bed with her! As they fall-- The bat SLAMS onto the mattress just missing them as --
Milton turns Baseball Bat's head into a canoe! Milton on bottom again as they crash to the floor, still intertwined.

dialogues.speaker: FWOOM
dialogues.text: The door adjoining Milton and Piper's room EXPLODES open his feet! MAN WITH AXE and MAN WITH SHOTGUN enter! Milton, presses Candy's face into his chest, twisting his body to shield her as his 357 THUNDERS twice! Shotgun's eye vaporizes in a mist! He drops to his knees. Man with Axe clutches his throat...blood gushing...turns flees back into the adjoining room as --

dialogues.speaker: KUH-FWAM
dialogues.text: The bathroom door flies open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring under the bed, Cowboy boots with duct tape patch appears. Chamber opens. Shells drop to dirty carpet. Milton rolls Candy over, still connected. Fumbles in his bag on the fl COWBOY with SLEDGE HAMMER freezes at the carnage. Can't s Milton. Because he's hidden by the bed.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY WITH SLEDGE
dialogues.text: Old Man. You know you can't stop what's comin' That little girl's as good as dead. TWO BULLETS slide into the 357. Chamber SNICKS shut. Milton aims under the bed. FIRES! Half the man's foot is blown to hell! He hops then crashe to the floor! He and Milton make eye contact beneath the bed...a nanose before Sledge Hammer's forehead implodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton rolls Candy beneath him again and raises his head in time to see--
MAN WITH SICKLE enter! He stares at his dead comrades in rage then glares at Mil The glare becomes fear. Milton's already aiming the 357, then --

dialogues.speaker: CLICK. CLICK-CLICK-CLICK
dialogues.text: Sickle smiles, raises the bladed weapon and--

dialogues.speaker: KUR-RUNCH
dialogues.text: The top of his head SPATTERS BLOOD as a hockey stick cras down from above and behind. Sickle drops to the floor revealing Piper, white knucklin the hockey stick...her face pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Apparently I shot my wad. Milton stares down into Candy's face. Her whole body QUAKES...CONVULSES. She sucks in breath an opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. You're the best fuck I've ever had. Piper crosses to the adjoining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Do you mind?! We're... Candy sits up and suddenly takes in her surroundings. She SCREAMS, wraps herself in a sheet and flees from the room

dialogues.speaker: HER ROOM
dialogues.text: Man with Axe is lying face down in his own blood. Dead. B it's Busboy who draws Piper's attention. Lying beneath bl drenched white sheets. He never saw it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, hell. Milton, in pants, pulls his shirt on, rolls Man with Shotgun's face with his boot. Reloads the 357.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I definitely got their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. The fuck? You know these people? Milton flings his duffle over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. There are probably more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah King slips from the bar and rushes toward a parked Sedan. He POPS the trunk and grabs a gym bag. As he cross toward the Driver's side door... The gym bag starts to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. Don't cry little precious. FF-FFUMP! Two doors shut. Jonah King turns, freezes. Our two State Troopers stand near their parked cruiser, staring from Jonah to the CRYING gym bag. For a cop, this is that one in a life time event. A caree maker. News. Media. Leno. Then-- The cruiser's back door opens. The Accountant steps out. ignores Jonah King and the crying gym bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troopers. Remember why we're here. He walks by them towards the front door of the bar. Both Troopers turn and move around the side of building. Jonah King...stares...stunned, he absentmindedly scratche the old scar on his face then leaps into the Sedan with t gym bag, engine ROARS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton and Piper exit into the back lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, I'm serious! I want some answers!

They turn as the SPEEDING Sedan tears onto the highway. A it disappears behind the barn it reveals -- --Man With Shovel. He FLINGS the barn doors open, stares Milton and Piper for a moment then vanishes within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we both want some answers. Milton moves toward the barn as-- The State Troopers walk around the bar. Everyone freezes. The Troopers stare from Piper to Milton, then back to Pip Recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw fuck. Milton grabs Piper, places himself between she and the Troopers as they go for their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Milton pulls the 357 and opens fire! The Troopers, emboldened and fearless, stand their ground shoot back!

dialogues.speaker: FFFUMP
dialogues.text: Milton staggers, clutches his side. A crimson spot spread across his belly. Piper tries to catch him as he stumbles falls to one knee, his duffle tumbles to the ground, clot spilling from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! The Troopers keep FIRING! Piper stares down at Milton's open duffle. There's a gun lying within the spilled clothes. An ancient six shooter. We get just a glimpse, but we can tell this isn't just an old gun. There's detailed inscriptions scrawled into the metal. The steel of it is thick, tarnished and somehow an She reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Not that one. He shoves the 357 toward her. Piper snatches it without hesitation, rises and --

dialogues.speaker: KUPOW
dialogues.text: Trooper #1's chest EXPLODES. The force spins him...still firing...he SHOOTS Trooper #2 in the ear! Both men crash to the ground. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: KAFOOM
dialogues.text: The barn doors explode outward as a big Dodge truck power toward the highway, Man with Shovel behind the wheel. Piper turns to find Milton struggling toward the GTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to stop him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton! Those cops weren't trying to arrest us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They weren't. Get in. Milton climbs behind the GTO's wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta patch me up. I'll drive. Piper fumes but climbs into the passengers seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car RUMBLES to life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were trying to kill us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Milton floors it! As the GTO fishtails toward the highway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Accountant steps from the back door of the bar. Hunter and Hunted glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. Piper's attention is still on the dead cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ is right! They start shooting with no warning?! What are you, a murderer? You escape from prison or something? The GTO tears onto the highway!

dialogues.speaker: IN REARVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: The Accountant just stands there...fading into the darkne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?! Which is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both. Piper raises the gun, points it at Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you gotten me into? I should...I should...Jesus, I just killed a cop! I'm going to prison. Give me one good reason I shouldn't shoot you in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean!
Milton gestures through the windshield, toward the distan brake lights ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took my grand-baby. Took my grand-baby and killed my... He breaks off. Looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the lighted Amber Alert sign come into view and quickly blur passed. Piper stares at Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl on the news? The baby girl they're looking for? Milton nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the news said the baby's parents were... Piper stops. Milton's eyes glisten. He speaks in a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sons of bitches killed my daughter. Piper stares. Milton steadies himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Yeah. I busted out. And I'm gonna get my grand-baby back. I'm gonna get her back and I'm gonna kill every last one of the fuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want out, I'll understand. Piper considers, then --

dialogues.speaker: KUH-FWAM
dialogues.text: They both slam into their seats as the GTO is rear-ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Trooper's cruiser. The Accountant, face blank, s behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton fights with the wheel as the muscle car fishtails. mashes the accelerator pulling out of the spin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back seat. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! Piper scrambles into the back seat as Milton watches the cruiser pull up along side him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shotgun. It's already loaded. Piper digs the shotgun from the duffle and heaves it into front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the other one ready. Not the 357. The OLD one.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH PASSENGER WINDOW
dialogues.text: The cruiser pulls up and matches the GTO's speed. After a beat the Accountant turns and smiles at Milton. Milton smiles back, lifts the shotgun, shoves the barrel through the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser's driver's side window explodes.

The Accountant brushes shattered glass from his shoulder. When he looks back at Milton its with a face of arrogance cat toying with a three-legged mouse. He pulls the cruise next to Milton. Matches the GTO's speed. Shouts across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Milton. Stop the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What makes you think you have a choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got something I gotta do first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should have done it a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have to do it a long time ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, I will kill that nice woman in the backseat to get to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again. What makes you think you have a choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. Piper hands Milton the ancient Six Shooter. Milton snatch it, points it across the gap between cars, pulls back the hammer with a thunderous...KUH-THUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This does. The Accountant's eyes widen.

It's as if God tripped, fell and the entire earth shook a result! The recoil nearly rips Milton's arm off. We travel with the slug, fire trailing it, as it SLOMOs toward the Accountant...his eyes continuing to widen...th muscles in his face contracting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Accountant cuts the wheel. Hard. He wracks his head around as the slug just kisses his che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cruiser SLAMS into the guard rail! The back-end rocke forward as the cruiser goes into a spin. The GTO fishtails away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton fights with the wheel as --

dialogues.speaker: IN REARVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: The Cruiser bucks up and over the guard rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cruiser, spins like a top, helicopters out over the nothingness and plummets to the dry valley below.

dialogues.speaker: KER-FRUNCH
dialogues.text: And flattens sending out a dusty shockwave in all directi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton manages to stop the GTO before it slams into the r The GTO BUCKS and STALLS. He breathes a sigh, then turns and stares in the directio they'd been going. He can just make out the fleeing Cultist's tail lights.
The back door opens. Piper leaps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper! Wait! Milton watches the taillights vanish over a distant ridge He starts the engine...then hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BACK WINDOW
dialogues.text: Piper approaches the destroyed guard rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper stares into the valley below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can just make out the flattened Cruiser in the light o the three quarter moon. No fireball. No smoke. No sign of movement. Just flattened metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not one of the ones who took your granddaughter, is he?

dialogues.speaker: MOVE TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Milton stands behind her. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anyone not trying to kill you? Milton stares up the road. Piper considers, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I'll help you. But we're dealing with that first? She points to his blood soaked shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GTO THUNDERS beneath a starry sky.

dialogues.speaker: SPEEDOMETER
dialogues.text: The needle hovers at 95 mph.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Piper behind the wheel. Milton, shirtless, his stomach wrapped in homemade bandages, grabs his shotgun, reloads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter got mixed up with the son of a bitch right out of college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew him? She knew Jonah King, the man they think killed... She stops herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew him. The world was in a fuckin tailspin and King was preaching quiet revolution. He places the shotgun on the dash, grabs the 357.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was four months before she realized âquiet' meant hiding in the basement, cutting the heads off chickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah King was into voodoo? Milton reloads the 357, slowly, methodically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voodoo, the occult, not much he wasn't into. When she told him she was leaving, he helped her pack. Gassed up her car. Cooked her a hot meal. Then while she slept he broke her leg in three places with a tire iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. She twists her pink bandanna nervously in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She learned her lessen. Was a good little follower for eighteen months. That's when they met with some witch doctor bullshit artist in Chinatown. It was Chinese New Year so the place was wall to wall slants. She saw her chance, stabbed Jonah in the face with a souvenir corkscrew and vanished into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton. Your daughter was in a cult for two years and you didn't know? Why didn't you help her? Milton grabs the ancient six shooter. It's got real weigh His blood-stained fingers run down the scrolled steel. Th gun almost seems alive. Pops the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't find out about any of this until...until I got locked up. Only two bullets left. He SNAPS the gun shut. Shoves it into his duffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not gonna reload?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only had three bullets to begin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights ahead. Several. And road flares. There's been an accident. Milton eases the shotgun into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several vehicles and an RV block the road. The PASSENGERS scramble back and forth. There's a jack-knifed flatbed, a crumpled Station Wagon and the Cultist's Dodge truck is overturned on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put. I won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton climbs from the GTO and crosses toward the overtur Dodge. He lets the shotgun dangle at his side, keeping it hidden behind him. TATTOOED GUY and SKANKY GAL stand near the RV with MAN IN LEATHER JACKET. BUSINESS WOMAN paces on her cell phone. Milton glances at MAN WITH WIG sitting in the driver's se of his station wagon, his face in his hands. LADY IN LEOPARDSKIN HOTPANTS kneels beside him. In the passenger seat, BURLY DUDE's on his phone. Watching Milton. There's a couple near the overturned Dodge. TRUCK DRIVING WOMAN gazes into the upsidedown cab. THIN OLD MAN rises a nods as Milton approaches.

dialogues.speaker: THIN OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I think he's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right? In a swift move, Milton RATCHETS a shell into the chamber drops to one knee, aims into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab is empty. Somewhere near, we hear a MUFFLED BABY'S CRY.

dialogues.speaker: MILTON'S FACE
dialogues.text: Realization. Shit. But it's too late. A snub-nosed .38 appears at his temple.

dialogues.speaker: THIN OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Milton! Milton rises slowly and takes in the situation. Tattooed Guy comes up fast behind the GTO. We get a good look at him. It's Man with Shovel. Piper's getting out, doesn't see Tattooed Guy until he's grabbed her. Presses pistol in her ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Let me go, fucker! She goes to fight but Man in Leather Jacket approaches he with an axe. Burly Dude is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't Piper! (to Thin Old Man) Let her go. She's a pain in the ass you don't want. Milton still hasn't let go of his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: THIN OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Drop it. Or we'll gut her. To emphasize the point, Truck Driving Woman pulls a Rambo Knife from her purse and smiles a missing toothed smile. Milton drops the shotgun as -- --Man With Wig steps from his car with a scoped hunting rifle. Lady in Leopardskin rises revealing a baseball bat with nails and spikes protruding from the end. Skanky Gal and Business Woman open the RV's door. Jonah King steps from within then smiles down at Milton. cradles a baby in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, isn't it? Why are you here? Why are you making such a fuss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that obvious, you sick fuck? I'm here for her. Milton gestures toward the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's obvious is that you clearly abandoned your daughter.
JONAH KING (cont'd) Crushed her so completely that she told everyone you were dead. No, Milton, I cannot in good faith hand over this child to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sacrificing her under the full fuckin moon, that's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Milton, your granddaughter is unbelievably blessed. Look around. The world's on fire. Companies own our governments and the people suffer. Daily. And will continue to suffer until change comes. And change will come. Thanks to your granddaughter, Milton. She will open the door to a new world order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your BS don't work on me. You killed my daughter but I won't let you kill my grandbaby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter's death was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shithead, it wasn't. I saw the whole damn thing. I saw who you are when no one's lookin'. And I saw what that night cost ya. Jonah's armor cracks a little as Milton faces the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, you're embarrassing your--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) --What was it three or four days before he showed after killin my little girl? You jerkoffs didn't notice he was walking a little stiff? Milton glances at Skanky Gal and Business Woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the last time he shared a bed with either of you? Before that night, right?
The girls shoot a nervous glance at Jonah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forced my daughter onto her knees, you sonofabitch. And she made you pay for it. Jonah stares at Milton in shock. How does he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't take my word for it. Ask him. Leather Jacket was there. Jonah made him swear not to tell. Jonah lifts a .38 auto from within the baby's blanket and shoots Leather Jacket in the forehead. Piper SCREAMS. The Baby starts CRYING. Jonah shoves the baby into Skanky Gal's arms then swings gun toward Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the blonde in the RV. Tattooed Guy shoves Piper toward the RV as Skanky and Business woman climb in with the baby. Jonah aims the gun at Milton's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only gonna make this offer once. Give me my granddaughter and I'll let you liv--

dialogues.speaker: KAPOW
dialogues.text: He shoots Milton in the left eye! Milton's head snaps, he falls to the ground on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!! Tattooed Guy shoves Piper into the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skanky tries to calm the crying baby. Tattoo shoves Piper onto the travel couch then hands the gun to Business Woma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Try something.
Jonah climbs into the RV, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him! You bastard you --

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: Piper's head rocks back as Business Woman pistol whips he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time I shoot that mouth right off your face. Jonah gazes out the window as the RV pulls away, Piper's rising behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton's body lays there. Unmoving. His one eye staring skyward. Void of life as the RV pulls away, leaving the cluster of cars, the wreck and body of Milton behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man With Wig pops the back of the Station wagon. Truck Driving Woman and Thin Old Man lean in, snatch two shovel Burly Dude drags Leather Jacket's body next to Milton's a the others join him. They gaze down at Milton, his one eye open and unseeing. single tear runs from it. The other, pools blood where th bullet entered. MILTON'S GOOD EYE TWITCHES. Everyone stares. Did they just see that right?

dialogues.speaker: THE 357 COMES UP IN MILTON'S HAND
dialogues.text: The bullet RIPS BURLY'S SCALP WIDE. He stumbles back. The others recoil. Burly ROARS, blood streaming from his head wound - charge Milton with the ax. MILTON unleashes rapid fire lead from the 357!
Burly's blown back! The others scatter as Milton staggers his feet! He grabs the shotgun, leans on it for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS Milton stumbles to the open passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN WITH WIG comes from the back of the Station Wagon wit the scoped hunting rifle. Aims. BLAM - His shot rips into the GTO, blows the side mirror Milton FIRES back with the shotgun - forcing Man with Wig back behind the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton falls heavily across the front seats. Ties Piper's bandanna around his head, covers his now gaping eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man with Wig hasn't had enough yet. He aims the rifle. Moves into the road. Can't see Milton in the car, but tha doesn't matter. He knows he's there. BLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windshield SHATTERS. Glass splinters down on Milton. reaches for the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cultists jump at the sound of the GTO's GLASS PACKS! Dust rips skyward as the GTO barrels toward them! They scramble, clawing at one another to get out of the w All except Man With Wig. He's playin' hero, lines Milton his sights. But what he sees shakes him to his core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON, face bloody and twisted with rage.
Man with Wig screams, falls, tries to roll out of the way

dialogues.speaker: FU-FUMP
dialogues.text: The wheels pound over both of his legs, SHATTERING them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton flips open the 357 as he FISHTAILS the GTO back on the highway. He dangles the 357 out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty shells DANCE onto the blacktop, several SKITTER dow onto the cracked Earth and OS. ANGLE - moving fast, the GTO's wheels consume the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bicycle tire SKIDS to a stop before us. Then a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two TEENAGERS sit on beat-to-shit mountain bikes, staring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cratered cruiser lies on its crushed roof, both doors shut. No windows visible. TEEN #1 lights a chillum pipe, inhales. Holds it, passes pipe, then speaks as only a pothead can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think anyone's in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inhales, holds, passes) I guess. Doors is still closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inhales, holds) Bet it's sick. Wanna look?

dialogues.speaker: KWU-FOOM
dialogues.text: The driver's side door launches right at us!
...nails Teen #2 in the chest, knocking him ten feet backwards where he skids on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! The Accountant rolls from the cruiser, stands, brushes himself off as he strides forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carpenter and despite what you've heard, prefers short hair. Teen #2 sits up suddenly, coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...you nearly killed me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close. I won't see you again until... He tilts his head, as if reading a sign too far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until you're seventy-three. He glances at Teen #1, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, I'll see in three months. And with that the Accountant turns and strides away.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The RV RUMBLES past, running faster than an RV should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah glances through the back window. Double takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rapidly growing black blotch on the road. In seconds th blotch reveals itself as the GTO ripping up the highway, gaining fast. The baby SCREAMS in the background. When Jonah speaks...it is with wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. He's still coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's still coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man. He's alive.

dialogues.speaker: TATTOO AND PIPER
dialogues.text: What? Piper tries to stand. Business Woman backhands her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down! That's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot him in the face! He can't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see? We stand at the crossroads! Did you think we would just idly change the world? The forces of evil challenge us! This is wonderful! We show ourselves to be worthy. I'm so very proud of each one of you. Tattoo and Business Woman beam. Skanky pulls her tit out, shoves it in the baby's face. T kid goes quiet as -- The back glass SHATTERS. Everyone ducks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton leans out the driver's side with the shotgun in hi left hand, his one good eye squinting as --

dialogues.speaker: KAFOOM
dialogues.text: He fires at the RV! He RATCHETS another shell into the chamber, takes aim then...hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front end of a fast approaching vehicle!
Milton's head snaps back as a 90 Corvette slams into the of the GTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady in Leopardskin behind the wheel, her eyes insane. Behind the Corvette we see a â92 Lincoln, Thin Old Man driving. Truck Driving Woman in a â95 Viper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton struggles to pull the shotgun back inside...strugg to keep the big GTO on the road. Distracted by the newcomers...we see what Milton does not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV pulls off the road to the left. Milton looks up just as he passes the turn off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! He SLAMS on his brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopardskin's eyes go wide. Survival kicks in. She jerks the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corvette slams into the side of the Viper! The Lincoln cuts hard right. All three cars shoot pass the GTO. Milton cuts the wheel left and floors it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper watches as the bucking RV forces Jonah and Business Woman to turn their backs on her.

Piper leaps from the couch, rushes up behind and shoves t toward the shattered back window! Jonah snatches a cabinet, drops his gun! It slides beneath the foldout bed. But Business Woman hits the giant opening and flips up an out of the RV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton looks up as Business Woman SLAMS into the ground a TUMBLES just out of his path. She sits up...dazed. Alive. Milton swerves...just enough...to...

dialogues.speaker: KAFWAM
dialogues.text: What doesn't explode from the force KUH-THUMPS as the GTO bucks over her body. Milton grits through the pain. A bloody angry smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah stares out the back glass in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am patient and forgiving, but that was wrong of you. He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill you now. And then I'm going to rape your corpse. So that in the afterlife you might consider your sin this day. Piper CRACKS her knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Between now and then. I'm'a fuck you up. He takes a step and swings a punch.

But she leaps at his face, closing the gap too quickly. H French Manicure digs in. Jonah screams. They both go down The baby WAILS. Skanky crawls into the cramped sleeper-bunk above the dri Pulls the baby with her, tucks back into the corner, away from the battle in the RV's cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton is gaining when --

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The back glass SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truck Driving Woman gains on Milton in her Viper. She's being blanketed in dust. BOOM! She fires a .44 Magnum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio and dash explode!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Milton snatches the 357, points it out the back glass and opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Milton's POV A white dot spider webs the Viper's windshield left.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Windshield middle!

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The windshield suddenly turns red from the inside as a do appears in front of the driver. The Viper jerks right drifts off of the dirt path!
The Lincoln bursts through the dust cloud behind it. Thin Old Man leans from the driver's window, FIRES. Slugs PEPPER the GTO. Milton spins in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV has pulled ahead and vanishes over a hilltop. Milton FLOORS it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper on top, Jonah's face looks like he ran into a barbe wire fence! He howls in pain and manages to slip a hand around her throat! Piper feels it. His fingers tighten. He shoves her away from him...she can no longer dig into his face. Her arms flail. Reaching for anything. Grasping. Her face turns red. Eyes bulge. Fuck. She claws his shirt open. And there...hanging around his neck is a small corkscrew. Chinese in design. She snatches it and --

dialogues.speaker: SHUNK
dialogues.text: Stabs it into Jonah's shoulder, twists it deeper in. He SCREAMS. Releasing her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: FOOM
dialogues.text: GTO rockets over the hill top, clears the ground ten feet The moment the GTO touches down, Milton BRAKES! Milton JOLTS the car into reverse! Tires SCREAM in protes

The GTO jerks backwards...climbing toward the top of the in reverse when Milton SNAPS the wheel. The GTO 180s, comes to rest just on this side of the hill Milton casually leans out of the driver's side window wit the shotgun in hand. He points it skyward as--

dialogues.speaker: FOOM
dialogues.text: The Lincoln ROCKETS over the hilltop...and passes directl over the top of Milton. Milton's one good eye zeroes in on the massive gas tank beneath the back of the car. Milton squeezes the trigger. The back end of the Lincoln EXPLODES as -- --The Corvette rockets over the hilltop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady in Leopardskin's face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln fireball SLAMS into the ground before her! Lady in Leopardskin shields her face as --

dialogues.speaker: KER-FWAM
dialogues.text: She slams into the burning vehicle and spins out of contr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton kicks the car into drive, jerks a 180 and speeds o toward the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah sits up...he pulls at the corkscrew and screams. It won't budge. He glares at Piper.
She scans for a weapon. Nothing. She snatches an umbrella from a coat rack. It'll have to do... There's a machete hanging beneath it. She drops the umbrella grabs the machete. Smiles at Jonah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the baby and I'll make the pain go away. Suddenly everyone SLAMS into the side of the RV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tattoo pulls the RV back onto Highway 70!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper clings to the old stove. She watches in horror as - Jonah's gun slides from beneath the foldaway bed. It slid right up to him. He snatches it. Piper leaps through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton is gaining as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper swings out, clinging to the door for dear life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper SLAMS into the side of the RV. She tries desperatel to hold on as -- Jonah leans through the door. Gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, child.

dialogues.speaker: MILTON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, dickless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah looks up. Milton is driving beside them, shotgun in hand, barrel aimed right at Jonah!

dialogues.speaker: KUH-FWAM
dialogues.text: But before Milton can get his shot off -- The Corvette SLAMS into the back of the GTO! Milton fires! Blowing a hole in the side of the RV a foot the right of Jonah's head! Jonah leaps back inside the RV. Piper clings on for dear life but she's slipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton jerks the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady in Leopardskin slows as Milton's GTO goes into a spi There's a smile on her face. She thinks he's lost control Until the GTO does a 180. Milton now driving in reverse. His shotgun pointing through the remnants of windshield.. ...directly at Lady in Leopardskin.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Her head goes buh-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corvette swerves off of the road, jumps a ditch and f thirty or forty times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper slips. Slips again. It's over. She knows it. Damn. She falls. FUMP.
And lands on the hood of the GTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, through the GTO's windshield into Milton's battered face. He stretches his hand out to her. Piper snags it before slipping off into oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got ya. Piper nods, crawls toward the windshield, Milton tries to pull her in as -- KUH-THUNK....CRUNCHCHCHCH... A horrible sound of grinding metal roars from beneath the GTO's hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GTO pulls to the side of the road. Milton leaps out and stares. He can just make out Jonah standing in the back window... holding his granddaughter. Piper eases from the hood. She stares at her bandanna, at the blood on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Milton. How? She pulls him close...looks at the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still in there. The bullet. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how...how are you still alive? He stares back toward the RV. Just a dot on the horizon n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't got time to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried, Milton. I tried to get her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, baby. I know. Jonah only had about twenty followers. We hurt him good today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin devil worshipers freak me out. They mess with powers that should be left alone. Turns my shit white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powers. It's all bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Milton. It's real. Ghosts, UFOs, bigfoot, that's the bullshit. The Devil and demons? Once those doors are opened you're fucked. Milton rolls his one good eye. Piper turns back to the GTO. Smoke hissing from the engin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to know a guy lived out this way. You got one of them portable phones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portable phones? You mean a cell phone? Yeah, in my bag.

dialogues.speaker: THE CRACKED EARTH
dialogues.text: As a hand slams into view, fingers with dirt crusted nail curl...dig into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Man With Wig crawls toward us. He's pale. Eyes dim.
His busted, mangled legs have left a slug trail of blood fluid stretching back to the highway. Left hand hits the ground, right hand digs into the dirt. drags himself forward a few inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crawling toward the Station Wagon. Someone...somewhere...is HUMMING Wig turns, squints.

dialogues.speaker: A SILHOUETTE APPROACHES
dialogues.text: Back lit by the early day sun. There's a bounce in his st Wig holds his hand out to the savior as-- The Accountant's smiling face becomes clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scorcher today, huh? He takes a big long swing from an oversized water bottle.

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH WIG
dialogues.text: Help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ on a cracker. My apologies. The Accountant grabs the man by the collar and drags him the shade of the Station Wagon where he flips him around a sitting position. Wig's shirt falls open revealing a pentagram tattooed abo his left breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH WIG
dialogues.text: It's a symbol of our pact with Lord Satan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pact huh? That's cute. Funny he's never mentioned you. Wig stares down at his mangled legs. The Accountant notic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, those are fucked. Here, have some water. Wig takes the offered water as Accountant kneels before h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton's work I take it?

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH WIG
dialogues.text: Ran me over with his...how do you...? Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Accountant. I'm curious. And I never get curious. What do you people want with Milton?

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH WIG
dialogues.text: You're the who? The Accountant smiles, places his hand around Wig's clear shattered femur and squeezes. Wig's body convulses! He SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it matter? Milton. Why is he important to you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH WIG
dialogues.text: He isn't! He's the one chasing us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Wig stares...searches for an answer. The Accountant snatches a mangled ankle and twists. Wig's body stiffens and he SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH WIG
dialogues.text: Because! Because of what we did. Because of who we took.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Color me curious. What DID you do and who DID you take?
The blood stained pink bandanna. The wind pushes it gentl down the black asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Milton sits on the GTO's hood. Piper stands between his l cleaning his wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme know if I hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what you gotta do. You get used to the pain. Piper pulls a black bandanna from her pack, there are whi skulls on it. She folds it, ties it around Milton's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. That's better. When she moves aside we see she's lined up a skull over h missing eye. A VEHICLE APPROACHES. Milton slides from the hood, steps protectively in front Piper as a banged up wrecker pulls toward them, pulls to side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: APPROACHING VEHICLE
dialogues.text: From this angle it looks as though an innocent old man an his granddaughter are having car trouble.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE GTO
dialogues.text: From this angle we can see Milton concealing the shotgun behind him. Piper stands close, her hand on the handle of the 357 protruding from his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the DRIVER steps out...stands half hidden by the door

dialogues.speaker: MOVE TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Like Piper, the Driver has his right hand tucked behind h back, wrapped around the handle of a .44 Magnum.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Thought you were dead.
Now we get a good look at him. His name's WEBSTER. An old black man, as tough as Milton is angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does everyone keep saying that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he IS dead. Sure as shit supposed to be anyway. Webster and Milton eye one another for a long beat then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I carried your coffin, old man. I was there the day we put your ass in the ground. Piper stares at Milton. Milton stares at Webster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster, you gonna yank that .44 or just keep stroking it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends. How's this possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard about my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you know why I'm back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back? Back from where? What. The Fuck. Are you two talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It true they took the little one? Milton nods. Webster considers for a long beat, then releases the .44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put her in neutral. I'll pull the truck around. But Piper can't tear her eyes away from Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police tape, half a dozen state and county cruisers. Thre meat wagons and a news van. Humans buzz the scene like insects. The two dead State Troopers lie where they fell. Undisturbed. ROOKIE stands out. Young, county uniform, wi eyed. Very busy at having no idea what he should be doing He scans the ground. His eyes go even wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge! Sarge look at this! Rookie squats to the ground as SARGE, leather skin, approaches, stares, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigarette butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge! It's less than twenty feet from the victims!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And less than three feet from the ash bin. Sarge points to an ash bin filled with sand. Over a hundr cigarette butts salute the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay attention, Rookie. But Rookie's attention has quickly OCD'd elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAP, an American Indian man walks the crime scene. Jeans, cowboy boots, a âDumbledore Dies On Page 596â sweatsh His dress may look out of place but his face and attitude all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! You can't be here! Rookie rushes forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rookie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge, this joker can't just stomp around the crime scene. Sarge catches up, nods with respect to Cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain. Sorry about that. Cap looks up then stares at Rookie's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir, I won't let it happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cap, he's green, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's standing on evidence. Rookie leaps back revealing two shell casings. Cap kneels, stares.
Suddenly a Unformed Officer leans from within the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cap! We got a live one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several officers motion Cap behind the bar toward an open cabinet. Cap crosses to the cabinet and kneels.
Candy hides within. Naked, hugs her knees. Shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a blanket. And get a medic in here. He turns to Candy, offers a comforting smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay now. I won't let anything happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He...he killed them. He killed all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You don't understand, we was fuckin'. He killed them while we was fuckin'. That's never happened to me before, has it happened to you? Cap turns to Sarge who is standing near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get a shrink in here too. EXT. WEBSTER'S WRECKER - DUSK - EST. A giant barn surrounded by an army of muscle car's laid t rest on cement blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engines dangle from assorted winches. Auto tools hang fro the walls. Stacks of tires, a pile of carburetors. Webster throws a lever. The wrecker winch lowers the GTO. Piper crosses to the front, pops the hood. Webster joins her, stares at the engine. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine's shot to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fix it? He leans close, hands caress the engine, searching. Somewhere near a fire CRACKLES. Piper turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton stands just through the barn doors, stokes a fire within a 50 gallon drum. Flames rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...how is this possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loved his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of daddy's love their daughters, doesn't explain shattering reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one loved his little girl enough to make her hate him. (off her stare) Like Timmy yellin' at Lassie to go home? Piper looks even more confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never watched...forget it. Milton was a bad husband but he was a good father. Used to say it was the only thing he was ever good at. Then we went and got mixed up with the wrong crowd. Power and money and once you're in there ain't no gettin' out. So to keep her safe he vanished the year before she went off to college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously you got out. Webster glances at Milton for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bastards we were workin' for, they were gonna kill us when the job was done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the day before, Milton paid'em a little visit. He went alone you see. I didn't know. I would'a gone with him but I didn't know. Webster goes very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being a daddy wasn't the only thing Milton was good at. Sumbitch was good at being a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun's setting to the West. Milton stands dangerously close to the fire. Stares at the dancing flames.

dialogues.speaker: WEBSTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: That fire makin you homesick? Piper and Webster approach with a six pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold beer? Milton gazes up at the moon. It isn't full but it's close The fire CRACKLES, POPS. He stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the pain and suffering ain't the worse part, right? That's what they tell ya, what they want you to believe. But it's all a big fuckin lie. Nosir, worst part's the goddamn video feed. Webster and Piper exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't about the fire and brimstone. Ain't about your suffering. It's about the suffering of them you love. Cuz you see it. You see it all. In full goddamn detail. And there ain't nothin you can do about it. Milton chunks a 2x4 into the fire. Sparks SWIRL into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin son-in-law. He looked like one of them tree-huggin piece of shits. Wore sandals. What kind of man wears fuckin sandals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I saw how he died. Fought like a fuckin banshee. Milton goes quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loved that daughter of mine. Loved that little baby too. He kept fightin long after he should'a been dead. But some people's better at killin than others. Just how they're wired. Milton's finding it harder to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then them sons of bitches turned on my...nosir, physical pain is nothin compared to watching your baby girl...watchin those fuckers...I'm gonna kill'em. I'm gonna kill'em all. And...and then I'll be done. Milton finally goes silent. Piper makes a noise. Involuntary. Tears stream down her cheeks. She's trying not to sob. Webster looks steely. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, I can't fix that car. But I can get you were you need to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge sliding barn door opens into a giant stall reveali 1969 Chevrolet Nova 396 L-78 and a 1969 Chevrolet Camaro. Milton and Piper stare. Webster smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milt, if memory serves you were always partial to the Nova, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're staring down over the barn from a distant ridge as hear the GLASS-PACKED RUMBLE of the Nova's engine.
JONAH standing on the ridge top, cell phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, about that fella who killed all them people at the Bull by the Balls last night. The fella who killed two of your cops. I know where you can find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises to the east burning off the Utah dew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton crosses to the 69 Nova. Stops. Stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper is curled up beneath a quilt in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Piper pops awake, sits up. Already angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck are you doing?! Milton stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you were gonna sneak off by yourself?! Go it alone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no. I need your help. If you're still willing. Piper stares for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if I'd known that I would have slept in a bed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton opens the big barn doors as Piper drives the Nova into the sun light. Webster approaches with a shotgun and a box of shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mapquest says it's an eight hour drive and we got twelve until midnight so we should be fine. And get this, âThe Mother of all thingsâ? âBleeds black tears unto those who cut herâ? Take a guess what's really bleeding like a stuck pig from the marsh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black tears of oil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster, I need you to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha? No. You went alone last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going alone this time. Piper's coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take that little girl over me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the fuckin shells. And the gun. Milton snatches both and hands them to Piper. He then quickly places an arm around Webster's shoulders and walk him out of earshot. Piper places the gun and shells in the backseat then star at the two men. They glance back at her several times. Then Webster nods. Milton returns, slides into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.
Piper stares out the window as Webster slips quietly into barn. He does so reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too old. He'll just slow us down. Get himself killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you told him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Timmy told Lassie isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this Timmy and Lassie you two keep talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't gonna be easy, Piper. I need you. That's no lie. But are you sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drive the damn car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a âWelcome to Nevadaâ sign as -- The Nova THUNDERS past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton behind the wheel, Piper has her bare feet on the windshield as she loads shotgun shells into the slits on hunting vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew him. Momma said he was a drifter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't your daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you if you are. Milton notices something in the rear view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Piper sits up, stares.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BACK GLASS
dialogues.text: There's a State Trooper's car way back there. Fuck. There are two. No lights yet but they are coming up fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet. Not until... The lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. They know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't stop. Milton mashes the peddle to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, this will never work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It won't. Nobody gets away anymore. In fifteen minutes there will be choppers, we'll be all over the news... She breaks off. Her mouth drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the NOVA tops a ridge, in the distance we see a police barricade. Several State Trooper Cruisers line the roadwa in front of a bridge crossing a dry ravine. Cruisers line the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty cruisers. Thirty TROOPERS are set up behind their vehicles, shotguns and assault rifles in hand.
Cap, the American Indian Police Captain, stands in front, radio to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep driving him to us. We'll do the rest. And make sure you peel off before the fireworks. He lowers the handset, addresses the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, these two killed two of our own. I know you'd like them to pay. Therefore, when I tell you to aim for the tires, what I mean is aim for their heads. Are we clear? The men nod with steely determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Please aim for the tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barricade is approaching stupidly fast. For the first time on this adventure, Milton looks...concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...I'm sorry I got you into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --They took your granddaughter, Milton, and now these badge-wearing fuckers are trying to stop you. You crawled out of the Goddamn abyss...and a few fat-assed county Mounties are giving you pause? Your grand-baby needs you. Milton nods. Turns back to the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what happens to her if they stop us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lose the last connection you will ever have to this world. You gotta drive. A scowl crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You don't just drive. Drive angry! Drive with the motherfuckin' rage that'll take us through that motherfuckin' roadblock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge from earlier approaches Cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Makes our job easier. Suddenly a noise catches them off guard. They turn behind them. Their eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mack Truck RUMBLES over the bridge approaching from beh them. It's pulling 80mph at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...this is unexpected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Accountant is driving. Calm. Whistling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper and Milton stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cap and Sarge scatter! Several Troopers leap or slide dow into the ravine as --

dialogues.speaker: KU-FWAM
dialogues.text: The Mack BARRELS THOUGH THE BARRICADE! Several Cruisers go airborne, sailing directly at us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton cuts the wheel hard as one of the Cruisers ROCKETS right at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cruiser's front end, hits the blacktop, digs in and f over! The Nova SCREAMS beneath it! The radio antenna SNAPS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Accountant smiles. Then cuts the wheel. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mack jackknifes. It slides sideways down the road toward the Nova!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nowhere to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shotgun! Piper shoves the shotgun in his hand. He quickly shoves i out the window and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICKFIRES three blasts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hydraulics line BURSTS! Hydraulic fluid bleeds like a stuck jugular! The metal brackets holding the trailer in place...RELEASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truck and Flatbed separate! The back of the flatbed catches on a cruiser. The front flips around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can just make out the Accountant's face. He's smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
