dialogues.text: The Nova rips through the opening between truck and trail And then blazes past the scattered and overturned cruiser and tears onto the bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cap staggers into the road, FIRING at the Nova!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! After them! Those men still near, scramble toward the working vehicle SCRRREEEECH. The Mack skids to a stop behind them, now parallel across blacktop. Driver's side angled back at the bridge. Every gun in the area spins as the driver's side door ope The Accountant steps out, big smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to shoot out his tires?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he smiles and flips his coin high into the air. The surrounding Troopers stare. The Accountant catches it. Holds it high between thumb an forefinger for all to see.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPERS
dialogues.text: He's holding an FBI badge in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Goddamn way. No ever-loving way in God's good heaven are you a... The Accountant steps down, thrusting his âbadge' into C face stopping him cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need you boys to stand down. Captain, you know what this badge means, right? Not a single gun lowers. All trained at The Accountant. Itching to blow him out of his expensive shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Bureau of get the fuck outta my way. You boys have blundered into an on-going Federal case. Now, lower your... He stops, turns...sniffs the air. His focus settles on a YOUNG FACED TROOPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. ANGLE - Looking down on The Accountant surrounded by arme angry troopers. He steps from the truck, nudges Cap aside like he wasn't there. Cap can't believe it. Shot continues, moving down, closer and closer until the Accountant is face to face with a Young Faced Trooper. The kid keeps his gun aimed, nervous, excited and confuse
Suddenly the Accountant moves fast. He bats the gun aside snatches the kid's uniform shirt and pulls it open, poppi two buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hey!!! Cap! And there...above the kid's left breast...a pentagram tat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems you're serving two masters. The kid says nothing stares. Every cop's gun is sighted o the Accountant. He doesn't seem to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take out your phone and call him. Call Jonah King. Tell him the old man is dead. The kid stares until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Trooper. Do as the agent says. Rest of you. Stand down. Now! Guns lower. The kid removes his cell phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tear West down the highway as we catch up to the Nova dive down...toward the back glass until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper stares through the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think...why aren't they following us? Milton slips into his hunting vest. A scowl on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're likely scared of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we drive.
We pull back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...out of the back glass as the Nova speeds up. Faster...faster. The sun suddenly time lapses across the sky. The landscape blurs. Only the Nova and the moving su remain...until the sun dips into the Western horizon and vanishes...replaced by one hell of a bright full moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly our view veers off the highway and rips toward a rocky outcropping in the distance. We slow and drop toward the ground until we're mere inche above the cracked earth...we come to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOOT slams into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton climbs from the Nova. In the distance we can hear DRUMS. BONGOS. There's CHANTING. And LAUGHTER. Piper rises and gazes at him over the roof. She's scared. Milton shoves the 357 into his back waistband, slides the ancient revolver into a leather hip-holster then he leans and grabs his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. Piper nods. Milton moves toward the jagged rocks in the distance but we can make out the flicking light of fire ahead as Milto moves toward a cliff's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton lowers to the ground and crawls to the edge.

A twenty foot drop off to the ravine floor below. The rav is filled with giant oil derricks, like metallic T-Rex's, rising and falling to the SHRIEK of oiled metal. And in the center of this Jurassic gathering, a CROWD of people dance and sway around a giant bonfire. It is celebration, ritual and orgy rolled into one. Brawny cultists erect a makeshift stone altar. On the opposite side of the Oil-Rig ravine - the battered RV sit like a mobile command post.

dialogues.speaker: MILTON'S FACE
dialogues.text: He was expecting less than twenty followers. There are fo down there. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton walks slowly back toward the Nova. His head lowere in deep thought. How does one man and a kid take on forty Suddenly a look of alarm crosses his face! He jerks the ancient revolver and aims it ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper sits on the hood of the Nova next to the Accountant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shoot you with this, you know what it means. No heaven. No hell. You cease to exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the more reason to keep Ms. Piper in close proximity. You are old, Milton. You might miss again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stop me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop you? Milton, you wouldn't be here without me, you ungrateful shit. That roadblock back there, that would have stopped you. So I want you to drop that iron God- Killer and say thank you. Milton stares. The Accountant, moves. Quickly. With a crisp flick, suddenly there's a blade at Piper's throat. She GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, drop it and thank you. Milton puts up his hand, flings the revolver into the darkness behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt her. Th-Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. He lowers the blade, but keeps Piper close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the first to get out and I doubt you'll be the last but I gotta know, HOW did you get out with the God-Killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just walked in and took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an old washed up lifer. Never occurred to'em that I was up to no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't wanna be you when he finds out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he gonna do? Not let me back in? Now, I gotta know. Why? Why help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why. It's because of those crazy fucks out there isn't it? They figured something out didn't they? Somehow they know how to summon a piece of hell to earth. The Accountant laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cute. You haven't told her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Ms. Piper, let you in on a little secret. The Dark Lord? Satan? Beelzebub? Lucifer? Simply the warden of a very large prison. Quiet man, actually. Thoughtful. Well read. I happen to know the idea of sacrificing children in his honor annoys him greatly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why? Why help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple. Like the warden, we all have jobs to do. Getting you here makes my job easier. You get what you want, I get what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then help me, now. There are forty of them down there. You and I could--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --No. You want to save her then go do it. If you win, I win. If they take you down, I win. He hugs Piper closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like butter on your popcorn? It's sure to be a grand show. Piper doesn't know what to say. The Accountant glances back at Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still here? Milton, the clock is ticking. Midnight approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get off my fuckin car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV door flings open revealing Jonah King. He walks wi arrogance through the orgy around him, his followers turn him with reverence. His name is WHISPERED like a secret. He approaches the make-shift stone altar where Skanky Gal holds the baby within a bundle of blankets. HIGH ABOVE: the moon is full and ripe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost time. Skanky Gal nods. But there is hesitation in her eyes. She grown attached to the baby. Jonah takes the baby, places her on the stone altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brothers and sisters, we have come so far. To this place where the dying earth bleeds its corrupt soul at our feet. From its death, it shall be reborn. As we will be. We who have survived the slings. The arrows. The revulsion of those too weak to believe. We have been cast out. And hunted. But no more. Followers gather, move in unison, dance, writhe, fuck. Tattoo approaches with an old rusty knife. It was probabl elegant once. Now it is worthless. He hands it to Jonah. The Followers GASP in holy awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising the knife) With this sacrifice, no more will we be shunned. They say the meek will inherit. They LIE. We are not meek. We are chosen. The hounds of perdition will howl at our command. For now we... A HOWLING noise. No. An engine. Distant but thunderous. Heads turn. The sound echoes throughout the ravine then -

dialogues.speaker: FOOOM
dialogues.text: The NOVA ROCKETS from the cliff's edge! It plummets straight at the cultists! They scatter! But three are not so lucky, they vanish as giant Chevy turns them to PULP! Jonah's jaw drops. This can't fuckin' be. Skanky Gal, grabs the baby and flees toward one of the gi oil derricks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton wears a mask of rage as he rips the Nova into a 18 his 357 aimed out the window.

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: He's shooting Cultists in a barrel. But the Nova is the better weapon. He FLOORS it, then LOC the brakes, fishtailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nova's ass-end veers like a dragon's tail SMACKING cultists aside with BONE-SHATTERING brutality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah grabs a shotgun from behind the altar, opens FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him! KILL HIM! Followers produce an assortment of firepower and RIDDLE t Nova with lead! Milton sights Jonah, ready to blow him to fuck, catches t reverend while he cocks the pump. JONAH can see Milton's got him. MILTON grits and pulls the 357's trigger: Click. Click.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Jonah fires a fresh round - barely missing as-- Milton GUNS the engine - SMASHES two followers head on. T fly up the hood, SMASH the glass - but shield him from another frontal assault. Their bodies RIDDLED with lead. The Cultists circle him to get a better shot. A Magnum is thrust into the driver's side window - right Milton's face. He leans back just as the gun is FIRED. Milton yanks the wheel, reverses the Nova - wrenches the Magnum from the fucker's hand. The Cultist hangs on. Claws at Milton. Milton twirls the Magnum, gunslinger style. Jams the barr into the Cultist's face and FIRES. Milton runs down any that get in his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Accountant stands above the battle, Piper at his side He can hear her heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chose you, you know that. Fast car, spunky attitude. He put your life at risk and you still want to help him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go. She rushes toward a goat path leading down to the valley below. Suddenly something catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: The Ancient Revolver. Without the slightest pause, Piper snatches it, spins and aims it right at... The Accountant's smiling face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on tight. It has quite a kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I kill you, you can't take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else will come...someone else always comes. Piper considers, the SOUNDS of battle rising from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper, he didn't steal that gun to kill me. He stole it to slow me down. He's getting what he wanted. Now, go to him. Before it's too late. Piper turns and scrambles down the goat path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton is ROARING in anger as the NOVA is PEPPERED with bullets and shotgun blasts. GLASS, SPARKS and CHAOS rain down on him. Steam and oil SPEW from the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ducking in the seat, unable to see, Milton fights to keep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah BLASTS the front driver's side tire, SHREDDING it -

The NOVA pitches hard to the left, PIN-WHEELING right int oil derrick. The SCREAM of metal on metal rips through the ravine. The Nova SCREECHES to a halt, tires SPIN, smoke spews, gas dr from the wreck. Jonah and the half a dozen remaining Cultists zero in aro the Nova, guns trained on the driver's door. Jonah nods to Tattoo who approaches close to the ground, reaches out slowly and YANKS the door open.

dialogues.speaker: KA-FOOM
dialogues.text: Tattoo is blown backwards by a shotgun blast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him! Jonah and his men open FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton SCREAMS as the Nova's cab turns into a warzone. He clambers deep inside the wreck. Praying they don't ignite the leaking fuel. Then the firing stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah and his men draw closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon they'll have a direct shot right into the Nova's ope driver's side door.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: The men spin to find Piper standing behind them, ancient revolver aimed into their group. She pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: KAFOOM
dialogues.text: Jesus wept. The KICKBACK blows Piper off her feet, the gu jerked from her hands. She lands on her back. Hard. The wind KNOCKED out of her.
The GOD SLUG slams into a cultist's stomach. It EXPLODES through him, and into the BATTERED RV BEHIND:

dialogues.speaker: KABLAAAAM
dialogues.text: The RV goes nuclear - blows shrapnel and cultists helter skelter across the ravine, shredding the remaining five. JONAH is spattered with his men's blood, dives behind the wreck of the Nova.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...this has all gone to shit. He steadies himself, grips the shotgun and shoves it into Nova's open driver's side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. The passenger door is open. Milton is gone. Jonah spins in all directions. Expecting a trick. But nothing. He rushes around the Nova to find... Milton crawling. Bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skanky Gal cowers twenty yards away beneath an oil derric The baby wrapped in pink blankets in her arms. Jonah walks up oozing arrogance. He knows he's won. He places the barrel of the shotgun to Milton's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here! Skanky continues to cower. Doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said get over here! I want him to watch me kill the kid! Skanky doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid bitch. Fine. Then just know I promise to kill her slowly.

Jonah raises the barrel to Milton's forehead then... Someone near CLEARS HIS THROAT. Jonah turns, stares. The Accountant leans against the Nova's hulk. He winks. At Jonah's feet, Milton scrambles forward and we realize wasn't crawling toward his grand-baby. He was crawling toward the ancient revolver. He snatches it, rolls onto his back as-- Jonah swings his gun toward Milton --

dialogues.speaker: KAFOOM
dialogues.text: The burning God Slug HITS JONAH IN THE FACE! Jonah's head is obliterated. The force yanks his headless body into the air, spins it sky-wards in a plume of flame The Accountant moves away, watching as -- The burning corpse slaps onto the leaking wreck of the No

dialogues.speaker: THE GAS IGNITES
dialogues.text: FLAMES ERUPT with THUNDER clear to the heavens - the Nova ROARS one final time, living up to it's name in a furious ball of fire that consumes whatever's left of Jonah King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper SUCKS in air. Sits up. Fire lighting her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton?! He lies on his back several yards away. Piper rushes up, falls beside him. He's alive, mouth filled with blood. She takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skanky Gal looks up to find... ...the Accountant standing over her. He holds out his arm
She hands him the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm curious. Would you have let him do it? She opens her mouth to speak, says nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. He turns and walks away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you. Soon. Skanky bolts. Races off into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton...no... Milton struggles. His head lolls back and forth. Eyes fli around. Searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where...where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here. The Accountant hands the baby to Milton. Milton stares at the tiny face. The big bright eyes. Innocent. Beautiful in every miraculous way. He places her in Piper's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep her safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. Anyone tries to hurt her and I'll kill'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. That's why I chose you. A HORN BLARES. They all turn toward the high cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEBSTER climbs from the 69 Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster will look after you both. As long as he can. And he'll keep trying long after he can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton. This can't...you can't just give up. There's gotta be something we can do to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat the devil? Nah. Never gonna happen. I'm askin more than I have a right to. I know it. But love her for me, Piper. Love her and make her yours. I don't have any right to ask for your promise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Milton. I promise. Milton coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And like that. The life fades from his eyes. Piper holds the baby close, SOBS. She looks up at the Accountant. But he is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun glows to the east as -- --Piper cradles the baby as she climbs the goat path wher Webster is waiting. He rushes to her, places an arm aroun her. Leads her toward the Camaro as --

dialogues.speaker: MILTON
dialogues.text: He twitches.
His one good eye opens. It rolls around then settles on something above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was that?

dialogues.speaker: MOVE TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: The Accountant stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen better. Guess she doesn't know you can beat him, slow him, shoot him, even stop him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But you can't kill a dead man. Milton sits up slowly. Bones CREAK. He holds his hand out The Accountant takes it. Pulls him to his feet. They turn and walk toward the rising sun. They walk until they are just silhouettes against a brigh yellow glow...then... ...they fade into the shimmering heat... ...and they are gone. FADE TO BLACK.
